intro: Loasa patagonica, commonly known as the Patagonian loasa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit, with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a central yellow stamen. Loasa patagonica is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
